near-dev-news-10-3232:
Welcome to the milestone **10th edition of NEAR Dev NEWS!** 🎉 To celebrate this , we've got something special in store for motivated web2 and web3 developers. Introducing our **Bounty Boost Program,** designed to reward the developers who win hackathons using NEAR tools. Keep reading for all the details.

In this edition, we'll explore the latest updates, highlight weekly activities, and developer opportunities with NEAR.

  
### FEATURED RELEASES & PR's 🤩
- 🚀 [**`near.cli.rs`**](https://near.cli.rs/) has new releases [0.9.0](https://github.com/near/near-cli-rs/releases/tag/v0.9.0) and [0.9.1](https://github.com/near/near-cli-rs/releases/tag/v0.9.1)
Enjoy even more help from CLI selecting the functions to interact if the contract supports NEAR ABI!

- **`near-jsonrpc-client-rs` Version 0.9.0 has been released:**
   - A new release of `near-jsonrpc-client-rs` version 0.9.0 was announced. This release includes improvements to the RPC server in nearcore. The update was credited to a specific contributor and was accompanied by gratitude for testing and final tweaks before release.
   - Check it out on 👉 [GitHub](https://github.com/near/near-jsonrpc-client-rs/releases/tag/0.9.0)

- **`near-api-js` Version 4.0.1 has been released:**
   - This includes support for the new `send_tx` function. The update allows all transaction sending functions to utilize the new function, providing improved functionality for developers!

- `near-rust-sdk` **version 5.1.0 has been released**. The highlights of the release can be found 👉 [here](https://github.com/near/near-sdk-rs/releases/tag/near-sdk-v5.1.0).

- `Wallet Selector` **Version 8.9.6 has been released**:

👉 Github --> https://github.com/near/wallet-selector/tree/v8.9.6
👉 NPM --> https://www.npmjs.com/package/@near-wallet-selector/core

- Discover more in releases and merged pull requests in our changelog 👉 [here](https://docs.near.org/changelog/2024/02/29/#-documentation).

  
### DEVELOPER UPDATES 🛠


1. **SDK 5.1 Migration Issues**: 

Developers encountered challenges migrating from `#[near_bindgen]` to the `#[near]` macro in SDK 5.1. An error occurred during ABI extraction, citing a lack of NEAR ABI symbols in the dylib. The issue was reported along with the relevant console command for reproduction. A GitHub branch was created for further investigation. 👉 [GitHub Issue](https://github.com/near/near-sdk-rs/issues)

2. **Serialization of u64/u128 in SDK 5.1**: 

Questions arose regarding the automatic serialization of `u64` and `u128` as strings for input/output in SDK 5.1. Developers observed discrepancies in return values between using primitive types and their corresponding `U64` and `U128` wrapper types. Community members discussed implications for contract interoperability with near-api-js and potential solutions to maintain consistent data representation. 

3. **Proposal for Privacy and Encryption SDK**: 

A proposal was submitted to DevHub for the development of a privacy and encryption SDK for NEAR. The proposal aims to enhance privacy features and data security on the NEAR platform. Community members were invited to review the proposal and provide feedback. The proposal includes details on the team involved and the objectives of the SDK. 

4. `near-cli-rs` **Enhancement** : 

We're improving near-cli-rs to display transaction fees in NEAR tokens and USD after each transaction. This enhancement offers users greater transparency and clarity regarding transaction costs. The proposed changes will involve modifying the `print_transaction_status` function in the `common.rs` file. This function will now include information about transaction fees, specifically the gas amount in the `ExecutionOutcomeView::gas_burnt` field.

 Follow the progress on [Issue #320](https://github.com/near/near-cli-rs/issues/320).

5. **Ui is NEAR Project Updates**: 

Progress updates were provided for the Ui is NEAR project, highlighting the completion of 15 components along with their respective functionality tests. The project aims to enhance the user interface experience for NEAR-based applications. The proposal link was shared for further information on the project's scope and objectives. 👉 [DevHub Proposal](https://near.social/devhub.near/widget/app?page=proposal&id=62)

6. **Integration of NEAR Data on LangChainAI via Mintbase API**: 

NEAR Protocol data is now accessible on LangChainAI through the Mintbase API. Community members were encouraged to explore the integration, which provides access to on-chain data for analysis and development purposes. A link to the documentation detailing the integration process was shared for reference. 👉[Documentation](https://github.com/langchain-ai/langchain/blob/master/docs/docs/integrations/document_loaders/mintbase.ipynb)

7. **NEP-536 and NEP-540 Approval Voting in Protocol Work Group Call #9:**

   In the recent Protocol Work Group call #9, NEP-536, which suggests adjustments to gas refunds, received positive feedback from all four working group members, leaning towards approval. However, NEP-540, focusing on storage staking adjustments, was unanimously rejected due to concerns regarding potential risks and limitations. 👉 [Recording](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=FPGNFDQ6rRA&t=429s&pp=ygULbmVhciBkZXZodWI%3D)

8. **API Updates for NEAR Transactions and Account Information:**

   Developers can now access transaction counts and account information via NEAR's API services. API3.NearBlocks.io provides endpoints for fetching transaction counts for specific accounts, while PikesPeak.ai offers similar functionality with authorization requirements. 👉 [API3 NearBlocks](https://api3.nearblocks.io/v1/account/slimedragon.near/txns/count) | [PikesPeak.ai](https://api.pikespeak.ai/account/tx-count/slimedragon.near)

9. **Protocol Update for Implicit Account Functionality:**

   The NEAR protocol update addresses issues with hex names and implicit accounts, ensuring compatibility and security by requiring non-0-9-a-f characters as the last character in account names. This prevents potential vulnerabilities related to implicit wallet transactions. 

10. **Intermediate Level Course Proposal on Promises and Asynchronous Smart Contracts**:

   - Community members proposed a new course idea focusing on Promises and their runtime interaction, tailored for an intermediate level audience. The course aims to delve into topics such as atomicity and designing asynchronous smart contracts effectively. Roman discussed the challenges of implementing a token swap scenario involving two fungible token contracts on NEAR's asynchronous platform.
   - Source: 👉 [NEAR Protocol Forum](https://gov.near.org/t/intermediate-level-course-proposal-on-promises-and-asynchronous-smart-contracts/5071)

11. **DEX Intermediaries for Token Swapping**:

   - Doc contributors suggested the use of intermediaries in decentralized exchanges (DEX) to facilitate token swapping, mitigating the risk of state changes in case of transaction failure. This approach involves a DEX acting as an intermediary to handle token swaps and ensure transaction atomicity.

12. **Testing Best Practices and Documentation Improvement**:

   - The documentation maintainer highlighted the importance of testing smart contracts thoroughly before deployment and suggested updating documentation to emphasize testing using workspaces over direct deployment to the network. He proposed a shift towards encouraging users to write tests that verify the expected behavior of functions.
   - Source: 👉 [NEAR Protocol Forum Issue](https://github.com/near/docs/issues/1930)

13. **Enhancement Proposal for Account Creation Documentation**:

   - Documentation contributors raised a proposal to improve documentation regarding account creation, suggesting the inclusion of instructions for creating accounts through plain contract calls in addition to CLI and sub-accounts. The aim is to provide comprehensive guidance on account creation methods.

14. **Cypherock Cover Announcement**:

 Cypherock Cover has been introduced as the industry's first multi-chain, non-custodial, and non-KYC inheritance-style recovery service for cryptocurrencies. The service offers early access to users and an additional year of service for early adopters. 👉[Twitter Announcement](https://twitter.com/rohanagarwal94/status/1782504675620655176?t=IbnJY4UuHD_nzrl90N08LQ)

15. **Hot Wallet App Testing**:

   Community members were urged to test hot wallet applications via a provided link. Additionally, discussions revolved around account on-ramping and integration with other platforms like PotLock. 👉 [Hot Wallet App Test Link](https://t.me/herewalletbot/app?startapp=web-app-potlock-org)

16. **Discussion on RPC Selection in Apps**:

   Developers engaged in a detailed discussion about the integration of RPC (Remote Procedure Call) selection within applications for better user experience. Various ideas were exchanged, including load balancing, automatic selection of less loaded RPCs, and considerations for free vs. paid RPC services. Links to relevant RPC providers were shared for reference. 👉[Near RPC Providers](https://docs.near.org/api/rpc/providers)

17. **Waitlist for NEAR Support on Coinbase Wallet**:

   A community member shared their involvement in the waitlist for NEAR support on Coinbase Wallet, emphasizing the importance of NEAR compatibility in the evolving multichain landscape.

18. **Nodies for RPC Access**:

   Nodies, a platform offering both pruned and archival data, was suggested for RPC access consideration. Performance benchmarks and documentation links were provided for further exploration. 👉 [Nodies Platform](https://www.nodies.app/) |
   [Nodies Performance Benchmarks](https://docs.nodies.app/performance-benchmarks/benchmark-standard)

19. **Issues with Testnet Support in Wallets**:

   Concerns were raised regarding the lack of testnet support in Here Wallet and Meteor Wallet. Community members requested assistance from the respective development teams to address the issue.

20. **Technical Debt in MyNearWallet**:

   A developer from the Meteor Wallet team acknowledged the technical debt in MyNearWallet, explaining the high number of RPC requests per account due to tight coupling with the Wallet class. Plans to refactor and decouple code were discussed to mitigate this issue.

21. **Pagoda** : 

- Improved QueryAPI logging system and DB connection pooling resulting in ~2-10 times better indexing performance.
- KitWallet has been migrated to use QueryAPI for Access Keys indexer, making it more reliable for wallets that still use KitWallet.
- QueryAPI hit all-time-high of 1.05M requests on April 26th, peaking at 400 req/second with ~250ms 95th percentile and ~15ms median GraphQL response time.

22. **NEAR's Instant Resharding with Nightshade v2's Stateless Validation** : Check what NEAR's Cofounder **illia** has to say about Instant resharding with Nightshade v2's Stateless Validation. Click 👉 [here](https://twitter.com/ilblackdragon/status/1785979116396667269)

near-dev-news-9-3233:
Welcome to NEAR Dev NEWS, your prime source for the latest in the NEAR Developer ecosystem! NEAR lays the groundwork for all blockchain apps, offering an open-source system empowering devs to create fully decentralized, interoperable apps. Our Digest showcases developer progress and technical updates shaping the blockchain OS.

In this edition, we'll be exploring updates , activities set out for the week, and discussing NEAR as a solution. 

  
### FEATURED RELEASES & PR's 🤩

- **`near-jsonrpc-client-rs` Version 0.9.0 has been released:**
   - A new release of `near-jsonrpc-client-rs` version 0.9.0 was announced. This release includes improvements to the RPC server in nearcore. The update was credited to a specific contributor and was accompanied by gratitude for testing and final tweaks before release.
   - Check it out on 👉 [GitHub](https://github.com/near/near-jsonrpc-client-rs/releases/tag/0.9.0)
   

- **`near-api-js` Version 4.0.1 has been released:**
   - This includes support for the new `send_tx` function. The update allows all transaction sending functions to utilize the new function, providing improved functionality for developers!


- `create-near-app` **Version** [6.4.0](https://github.com/near/create-near-app/releases/tag/v6.4.0) **has been released!**
👉 Sandbox testing now follows the same language as the contract created
👉 Removed vanilla frontend since very few people was using it
👉 Frontend now creates FC key for hello.near-examples.testnet by default


- `near-rust-sdk` **version 5.1.0 has been released**. The highlights of the release can be found 👉 [here](https://github.com/near/near-sdk-rs/releases/tag/near-sdk-v5.1.0).

- `nearcore` **Version 1.39.1 has been released** This release includes performance optimisations in the pre-fetcher logic and the network stack.

- `Wallet Selector` **Version 8.9.6 has been released**:

👉 Github --> https://github.com/near/wallet-selector/tree/v8.9.6
👉 NPM --> https://www.npmjs.com/package/@near-wallet-selector/core


- Discover more in releases and merged pull requests in our changelog 👉 [here](https://docs.near.org/changelog/2024/02/29/#-documentation).


  
### DEVELOPER UPDATES 🛠

1. **New RPC Endpoint Deprecation Notice:**
   - A community member raised a question regarding the deprecation of the `send_transaction` async endpoint in the NEAR Protocol RPC documentation. This led to clarification that the endpoint is deprecated in favor of a more flexible `send_tx` method with `wait_until = NONE`. 
   - [Documentation Link](https://docs.near.org/api/rpc/transactions)


2. **Discussion on Network Congestion and Asynchronous Transactions:**
   - Community members discuss the default status of asynchronous transactions (`sendTransactionAsync`) in NEAR. They talked about the potential benefits of using async transactions to reduce network congestion. While opinions varied, it was highlighted that network congestion should be addressed at the protocol level rather than altering default behaviors for library users.

3. **Issue Report and Fix Proposal for `near-jsonrpc-client-rs`:**
   - Developers reported an issue related to the newly created `send_tx` example in the `near-jsonrpc-client-rs` library. The issue was documented in a GitHub repository along with the identified root cause. 
   - Check out the 👉 [GitHub Issue Link](https://github.com/near/near-jsonrpc-client-rs/issues/141)

4. **Proposed Improvement for NEAR CLI-RS:**
   - There were proposed improvements to NEAR CLI-RS this week! regarding the generation of public keys from plain text private keys during signing. The suggestion was to automate the generation process to enhance user experience. Details about the proposal and potential implementation strategies were discussed.

5. `Documentation` **Course Extension on NEAR JavaScript SDK:**
   - An extension to the Introduction to NEAR JavaScript SDK course has been implemented, targeting beginner users.
   - Lessons 5 to 11 are new, while lessons 1 to 4 have undergone minor adjustments.
   - Feedback on inaccuracies or areas for improvement is welcomed.
   - Course link: [Introduction to NEARJS](https://staging.agorapp.dev/ide/near/typescript/introduction-to-nearjs)

6.  `Documentation` **Review and Corrections:**

   -  A potential issue was identified and reported with the code example provided in the `NEAR API JS` documentation.
   - The example regarding account creation may be misleading as it focuses solely on sub-account creation.
   - GitHub Issue 👉 [Docs Issue #1926](https://github.com/near/docs/issues/1926)

7.  `Documentation` **Integration of New Resources:**
   - New resources have been integrated into the NEAR documentation and ecosystem.
   - Mintbase templates, Learn NEAR Club, and Agora App have been added to the main page, menu, and footer.
   - Pull Request: [Documentation PR #1922](https://github.com/near/docs/pull/1922)
   - Preview: [Docs Preview](https://docs-preview-pr-1922.onrender.com)

8. **Educational Initiative Proposal:**
   - There's been a proposal for a new educational course focusing on Promises and their runtime interaction. The course aims to explore Promises in depth, including atomicity and asynchronous smart contract design.
   - Consideration is given to implementing a token swap functionality as part of the course curriculum.

9. **Sample Application and Security Challenge:**
   - A sample application demonstrating a security challenge regarding NearPromises has been created.
   - The application showcases scenarios where the behavior of promises is not entirely clear or functional.
   - Community members are invited to review the sample application and provide insights or solutions to the challenges presented.
   - Check out [NEAR Double Spending Example](https://github.com/romario333/near-double-spending-example)

10. **Resource Recommendations:**
   - Community leaders recommend watching videos on NEAR runtime for a better understanding of its concepts and functionalities.
   - The provided resources aim to enhance developers' knowledge and proficiency in working with NEAR Protocol.
   - Recommended Video: [NEAR Runtime Overview](https://docs.near.org/concepts/basics/runtime#runtime-overview)

11. **TOKEN2049 Dubai:** We showcased the NEAR ecosystem at TOKEN2049 Dubai following our successful presence at TOKEN2049 Singapore. Highlights include sessions on decentralized AI with Illia Polosukhin and a discussion on Web3's billion-user blueprint featuring NEAR Foundation COO Chris Donovan and Sweat founder Oleg Fomenko. For more details about this, check out this 👉 [post](https://twitter.com/NEARProtocol/status/1779888104737796269)

12. **NEAR Bounty Boost Program:** DevHub introduces the NEAR Bounty Booster Program to incentivize developers utilizing NEAR tools in non-NEAR-sponsored hackathons. By offering cash boosts for winning projects, NEAR matches a percentage of your hackathon prize money, up to $5,000 per team, determined by the NEAR DevHub team. To learn more, click 👉 [here](https://near.social/devhub.near/widget/app?page=blog&id=3021)

13. `Article` **Jutsu & Dev/Hub Collaboration -Q1 Milestones** . Learn more 👉 [here](https://blog.jutsu.ai/jutsu-dev-hub-collaboration-q1-milestones/)

14. `Article` **Compare the two frameworks NEAR BOS: ROC and Além.** Learn more 👉 [here](https://steveyu.xlog.app/roc-vs-alem)

15. Two leading dApps on NEAR Protocol, KaiChing and HOT, are garnering high weekly active users on DappRadar. Learn more 👉 [here](https://twitter.com/David___Mo/status/1782740640377209070). 

16. **Contract Standards** : 
 - The contract standards WG voted to approve NEP-330, which introduces new capabilities to NEAR smart contracts by introducing build details to the contract metadata.
 - Learn more about NEP-330 [here](https://github.com/near/NEPs/pull/533)


  
### THIS WEEKS TIPS 💡

- `Tip`: A request was made to report broken links. The suggestion was to open an issue on the docs GitHub or make a PR with the proper link. The relevant link for documentation issues is 👉 [here](https://docs.github.com/).

- `Tip`: You can re-create a transaction in [near.cli.rs](https://github.com/near/near-cli-rs), edit it and send again with ease. Using interactive mode of near CLI, select "transaction" -> "reconstruct-transaction". You will get a new CLI command constructed for you to edit and run.

- `Tip`: Need to top-up USDT to a NEAR wallet on the test network? Use a faucet. [Faucet Link](https://near-faucet.io/).

- `Tip`: Need help checking whether a NEAR account ID exists or not? Use the fetch API available via BOS to make an RPC query call to get account information.

- `Tip` List of all the current NEAR Stakers: https://near-staking.com

- `Tip`: For more resources on Chain Signatures, check out this 👉 [linktree](https://linktr.ee/chainsignatures).

- `Tip`: **New to NEAR? 👨‍💻 :** Whether you're familiar with Rust , JS, or simply eager to contribute to NEAR tooling, begin your journey with comprehensive NEAR docs and DevHub resources 👇:

1. NEAR docs: [Link](https://docs.near.org/)
2. DevHub: [Link](https://neardevhub.org/)
3. Engage with NEAR Tools 👉[here](https://near.social/devhub.near/widget/app?page=blog&id=2496)
4. Join the Community: Have questions? Join the lively discussions in [neardev](https://t.me/neardev) Telegram group.
5. Office Hours: Get personalized assistance during our [DevHub Office Hours](https://near.social/devhub.near/widget/app?page=community&handle=devrel&tab=office-hours).

  
### RECENTLY UPDATED NEP'S ✅

**APPROVED NEPs**: 

A successful NEP is one that addresses a specific problem or needs within the NEAR ecosystem. These are the NEPs that were approved by the protocol workgroup this week:

- [NEP-519: Support for yielded execution](https://github.com/near/NEPs/pull/519) - Protocol Update | **8th March 2024**
- [NEP-491: Non-Refunable Storage](https://github.com/near/NEPs/pull/491) - Protocol Update | **26th Feb 2024**
- [NEP-330: Build details extension](https://github.com/near/NEPs/pull/533) - Contract standards Update 
  

**REVIEW STAGE**:

Subject matter experts are currently reviewing the following NEPs. Some of the working group members are also deciding whether to accept or reject them. Feel free to explore, these NEPs will aid you during your development as you integrate them with your dApps. Share your thoughts and leave a comment.

- [NEP-536: Reduce the number of refund receipts](https://github.com/near/NEPs/pull/536) - Protocol Update
- [NEP-540: Reduce storage staking price by 10x](https://github.com/near/NEPs/issues/540) - Protocol Update


To learn more about NEP's click 👉 [here](https://github.com/near/NEPs/blob/master/neps/nep-0001.md) 
To view all the NEP's click 👉 [here](https://github.com/orgs/near/projects/51/views/1)



  
### HACKS OF THE WEEK 👨‍💻🏆

- [2FA](https://taikai.network/cryptocanal/hackathons/ethdam2024/projects/cluz0xnnj013uz301nfa9uj4g/idea) - A two factor authentication multisig wallet that allows one to send tokens and mint NFTs on multiple networks. "FA had a great UX, exciting implementation of chain signatures and proper use case.

- [Feedback](https://taikai.network/cryptocanal/hackathons/ethdam2024/projects/cluyuw0j200y3yz01yjjd4rap/idea) - A privacy preserving B2C survey platform that creates a NEAR account from a participants phone number used to derive an Ethereum Account and submit a cross chain private vote. Amazing integration with survey phone calls and blockchain, great potential.

  
### CHAIN ABSTRACTION COMMUNITY 🤩

The chain abstraction community has been actively engaged in discussions and developments aimed at enhancing interoperability and standardization across different blockchain networks.They have been exploring techniques like Multi-Party Computation (MPC) to address security and key management concerns. Discussions around key rotation within MPC systems have been gaining traction, as highlighted in recent community exchanges. As part of ongoing efforts to streamline development practices, there have been discussions on standardized deployment data storage practices, with community members advocating for transparent and accessible repositories of contract deployment information. 

Check out this 👉 [GitHub repository](https://github.com/near/mpc-recovery) containing code for MPC contracts, illustrating the implementation of payload-based key management for chain signature requests and responses.

For further details, you can refer to the following links:

👉 [Chain Signatures Documentation](https://docs.near.org/concepts/abstraction/chain-signatures)
👉 [NEAR Multichain Example](https://github.com/near-examples/near-multichain)
👉 [Chain Signatures Use Cases](https://docs.near.org/concepts/abstraction/signatures/use-cases)
👉 [FastAuth SDK Documentation](https://docs.near.org/tools/fastauth-sdk)
👉 [NEAR NFT Minting on Farcaster](https://warpcast.com/brower1/0xab61fd1b)

[Learn more about the Chain Abstraction Community](https://near.social/devhub.near/widget/app?page=community&handle=chain-abstraction)


  
### CALL FOR CONTRIBUTORS 📞

-  Ecosystem developers propose a devcontainer image for examples encompassing both Rust and Node tooling. Volunteers are welcomed to contribute to `near-devcontainers` and test the additional container on examples. [Join Tools Community](https://t.me/NEAR_Tools_Community_Group)

- We've initiated alpha testing the BOS web engine for creating decentralized front end components on NEAR. Get involved today by following this [link](https://bwe-docs.near.dev/).

- NEAR Horizon 2 Cohort invites developers like you to step into scaling decentralized applications. More details 👉[here](https://twitter.com/nearhorizon/status/1768310840120189123).

- With the upcoming SDK 5.1 release, there will be updates needed in transitioning from #[near_bindgen] to #[near]. Matias is working on documentation updates, but additional assistance may be required. Don't hesitate to reach out if you can lend a hand! Reach out to [Docs community](https://t.me/neardocscg).

- Given the release of the new SDK, both docs and example repositories need updating. If you want to contribute , [join the Docs Community Group](https://near.social/devgovgigs.near/widget/gigs-board.pages.community.activity?handle=documentation).

- Check out [DevHub's On-Chain Quests](https://near.social/devhub.near/widget/app?page=community&handle=challenges) ⛳️, where you'll find a dynamic array of challenges across various communities, earning recognition and respect as you conquer each one!

-near-dev-news-7-3235:
Welcome to NEAR Dev NEWS, your prime source for the latest in the NEAR Developer ecosystem! NEAR lays the groundwork for all blockchain apps, offering an open-source system empowering devs to create fully decentralized, interoperable apps. Our Digest showcases developer progress and technical updates shaping the blockchain OS.

In this edition, we'll be exploring a plethora of updates and activities set out for the week, designed to keep you engaged with developers within the NEAR community. 

  
### FEATURED RELEASES & PR's 🤩

- **NEAR Rust SDK has been released** The highlights of the release can be found 👉 [here](https://github.com/near/near-sdk-rs/releases/tag/near-sdk-v5.1.0).

- `nearcore` **Version 1.39.0 has been released** this week and function call base cost is reduced. For small transactions like on [Cosmose](https://twitter.com/Cosmose_) and [hotdao](https://twitter.com/hotdao_), it is a 2x reduction in cost and 2x in throughput. RPC is now faster! Learn more 👉 [here](https://github.com/near/nearcore/releases)

- `near-api-js` **Version 4.0.0 has been released**. It contains:

👉 More than 36% bundle size reduction (from 380kb to 240kb). Info 👉[here](https://bundlephobia.com/package/near-api-js@4.0.0)
👉 Failover RPC configuration
👉 Executing view functions without the need of a Connection object and more!
👉 You can read more about the changes 👉 [here](https://github.com/near/near-api-js/pull/1318)!

- `Wallet Selector` **Version 8.9.6 has been released**:

👉 Github --> https://github.com/near/wallet-selector/tree/v8.9.6
👉 NPM --> https://www.npmjs.com/package/@near-wallet-selector/core

- Discover more in releases and merged pull requests in our changelog 👉 [here](https://docs.near.org/changelog/2024/02/29/#-documentation).


  
### DEVELOPER UPDATES 🛠

- Users discussed tutorials for creating a bot to monitor transactions on the NEAR blockchain. Check out [NEAR Lake Framework Documentation](https://docs.near.org/concepts/advanced/near-lake-framework). It leverages pikespeak.ai 👉 [here](https://t.me/nearwatchbot). You can also check out [this repository](https://github.com/k-o-l-e-s/LNC-NEAR-watcher), a simple bot to get notified about TX's on NEAR's Mainnet.

- Developers engaged in discussions about the possibility of NEAR's capability to sign Secp256k signatures for NFC chips. 

- Fast NEAR announces the new NEAR Data server! It's a simple and free alternative to the NEAR Lake Framework for data indexing. Click 👉 [here](https://twitter.com/fast_near/status/1777814928646197417) to learn more.

- Developers discussed the validity period of signed transactions and the possibility of migrating contract state. They explored the technical aspects of transaction validity and contract state migration within the NEAR blockchain ecosystem.

- Catch up on the recording of our live event with Hacken discussing WASM code coverage 👉 [here](https://twitter.com/i/spaces/1MYxNoAjnAXKw/peek?s=20).

- NEAR Foundation Launches Infrastructure Committee with $4 Million in Funding. Learn more 👉 [here](https://pages.near.org/blog/near-launches-infrastructure-committee/)

- A developer encountered a technical issue while attempting to broadcast a transaction on Ref with MNW, resulting in an error message. Discussions focused on diagnosing the cause of the issue, including potential reasons such as network connectivity problems or RPC issues.

- Looking for a production ready rust contract made on `near-sdk` 5.1.0? Reference DevHub’s contract 👉 [here](https://github.com/NEAR-DevHub/neardevhub-contract).

- Mark your calendar, starting this Thursday, DevHub will be streaming LIVE & unedited! Each week we will have guests to talk development, teach technical concepts, dev news, code reviews, and more. [Live on X](https://twitter.com/NEARDevHub) and [Twitch](https://twitch.tv/neardevhub). 

- Pagoda releases Chain Signatures that simplify user experiences by enabling users multichain access without leaving their NEAR account, unlocking billions of dollars in previously inaccessible liquidity.

- Community members inquire about retrieving the epoch start block height via RPC. Ecosystem Devs suggests accessing it through the validators RPC endpoint, which you can find 👉 [here](https://docs.near.org/api/rpc/network#validation-status).

- Seeking documentation about MultiSig on NEAR. Check out the MultiSig contract repository 👉 [here](https://github.com/near/core-contracts/tree/master/multisig).

- Proximity labs shares Ideas for building with chain signatures 👉 [here](https://twitter.com/proximityfi/status/1774723437032038408?t=Y_oem9i384uPvwRIZKOuiw&s=35).

- Developers requested a demo/tutorial for testing substream setup for NEAR blockchain.

- User inquired about the availability of a no-std NEAR SDK. A link to nesdie repository was shared. 👉 [nesdie GitHub repository](https://github.com/austinabell/nesdie/).

- Users discussed the challenges of retrieving token metadata, particularly for FTs, through various APIs. Suggestions for potential APIs were mentioned, such as [Fast NEAR](https://twitter.com/fast_near/status/1773398764859847008?t=9a8M8CwJqNBxNcW1p2d8DA&s=19) and [Pikespeak](https://doc.pikespeak.ai/).

- Tools Community call and DevHub Livestream recordings are now available on [DevHub's Youtube](https://www.youtube.com/@NEARDevHub)

- Developers provided an update on the signMessage issue and shared the latest developments on [GitHub](https://github.com/near/near-wallet/issues/3135).

- Login functionality is being migrated to the wallet selector.

- Developers discussed the challenges with wallet integration and offline signing standards. They referenced an [issue on GitHub](https://github.com/near/wallet-selector/issues/405) related to this topic.

- The Protocol Work Group prepares to vote on NEP-536, a proposal to optimize NEAR protocol's performance. NEP-536 focuses on reducing the number of refund receipts, a significant contributor to runtime overhead. Don't miss this opportunity to contribute to the discussion 👉 [here](https://github.com/near/NEPs/pull/536).

- Developers offered assistance on deleting a wallet and provided instructions on using a specific tool for the process. [Tool Link](https://lantstool.io/).

- Developers Discussed changes in the Gas struct and its usage, particularly emphasizing the transition from manipulating raw integers to using dedicated constructors like `Gas::from_tgas()`. [Gas Struct Documentation](https://docs.rs/near-sdk/latest/near_sdk/struct.Gas.html).

- Discussions continued on the handling of promises in code implementations, specifically regarding their execution and impact on transaction returns. Various considerations were raised regarding serialization and atomicity in NEAR Protocol transactions.

- [NEAR protocol 2024 roadmap update](https://near.org/blog/near-q4-protocol-roadmap-update).

- Jutsu.ai expressing interest in collaborating to onboard web2 developers to web3.

### CHAIN ABSTRACTION COMMUNITY 🤩

The chain abstraction community has been actively engaged in discussions and developments aimed at enhancing interoperability and standardization across different blockchain networks.They have been exploring techniques like Multi-Party Computation (MPC) to address security and key management concerns. Discussions around key rotation within MPC systems have been gaining traction, as highlighted in recent community exchanges. As part of ongoing efforts to streamline development practices, there have been discussions on standardized deployment data storage practices, with community members advocating for transparent and accessible repositories of contract deployment information. 

Check out this 👉 [GitHub repository](https://github.com/near/mpc-recovery) containing code for MPC contracts, illustrating the implementation of payload-based key management for chain signature requests and responses.

near-dev-news-6-3237:
Welcome to NEAR Dev NEWS, your prime source for the latest in the NEAR Developer ecosystem! NEAR lays the groundwork for all blockchain apps, offering an open-source system empowering devs to create fully decentralized, interoperable apps. Our Digest showcases developer progress and technical updates shaping the blockchain OS.

Before we kick into updates for the new week, please take the time to fill out our survey and play a pivotal role in shaping the ecosystem. Your feedback will provide valuable info to builders and contributors, paving the way for FRPs (Request for proposals) on DevHub. 

###### [CLICK HERE TO FILL SURVEY 🏆](https://bit.ly/devhub-survey-q1-2024)

Thank you for participating, now let’s get into the updates!


  
### FEATURED RELEASES & PR's 🤩

- **NEAR Rust SDK 5.1 IS OUT!** The highlights of the release can be found 👉 [here](https://github.com/near/near-sdk-rs/releases/tag/near-sdk-v5.1.0).

- `nearcore`: Version 1.38.1 has been released . This does not contain a protocol upgrade and it is optional. However, we recommend all node operators to upgrade to this release since it brings performance improvements. Learn more 👉 [here](https://github.com/near/nearcore/releases/tag/1.38.1)

- Discover more in releases and merged pull requests in our changelog 👉 [here](https://docs.near.org/changelog/2024/02/29/#-documentation).


  
### DEVELOPER UPDATES 🛠

- The Ledger App for NEAR,  is currently undergoing a comprehensive security audit. We anticipate having the final report ready by April 22nd!

Exciting new features included in this version:

👉 Support for transactions of any size, with streaming preview implementation.
👉 Capability for signing meta-transactions (DelegatedAction).
👉 Added support for message signing NEP.

This is a significant milestone for Near Ledger users, promising enhanced functionality and security. Stay tuned for the official report release on April 22nd!

- There's a technical discussion about the possibility of running AI as a NEAR smart contract. it's an interesting topic worth exploring further. Learn more 👉 [here](https://twitter.com/ekuzyakov/status/1756812617505542578)

- Pagoda launches Multichain Gas Relayer which removes the need for users to have the native gas token of another chain in order to transact; instead they can just use NEAR or NEP-141 tokens to cover gas on any chain, not just NEAR or EVM chains.

-  Pagoda releases Chain Signatures that simplify user experiences by enabling users multichain access without leaving their NEAR account, unlocking billions of dollars in previously inaccessible liquidity.

- There's an ongoing discussion regarding an issue with building contracts using `near-sdk-js`. It seems that deploying to a fresh account might resolve the issue. For more information and troubleshooting steps, check out the 👉 [documentation](https://docs.near.org/tutorials/examples/update-contract-migrate-state). 

- Near-sandbox version 0.0.18 has been published to npm by Vlad Frolov. You can find more information about it 👉 [here](https://www.npmjs.com/package/near-sandbox/v/0.0.18).

- Community members inquire about retrieving the epoch start block height via RPC. Ecosystem Devs suggests accessing it through the validators RPC endpoint, which you can find 👉 [here](https://docs.near.org/api/rpc/network#validation-status).

- Seeking documentation about MultiSig on NEAR. Check out the MultiSig contract repository 👉 [here](https://github.com/near/core-contracts/tree/master/multisig).

- Chain Signatures Launch to Enable Transactions on Any Blockchain from a NEAR Account . Read 👉 [here](https://pages.near.org/blog/chain-signatures-launch-to-enable-transactions-on-any-blockchain-from-a-near-account/)

- Proximity labs shares Ideas for building with chain signatures 👉 [here](https://twitter.com/proximityfi/status/1774723437032038408?t=Y_oem9i384uPvwRIZKOuiw&s=35).

- Users encountered an issue where the RPC response required more NEAR for a transaction than specified in the frontend. Ecosystem Devs suggested updating dependencies or removing package-lock.

- Users reported encountering a 502 Server Error when attempting to call a view method on a testnet contract, which was later resolved.

- Did you know there are multiple Rust CLI tools available for different purposes within the NEAR ecosystem? These include:

👉 `near-cli-rs`: [A general-purpose CLI tool for NEAR protocol operations and interactions](https://github.com/near/near-cli-rs).
👉 `bos-cli-rs`: Specifically designed for BOS development, offering dedicated commands for working with BOS contracts and components.
👉 `cargo-near`: [A Rust Cargo extension tailored for Rust contract development on the NEAR platform, providing commands for project creation, building, and deployment](https://github.com/near/cargo-near).
👉 `near-validator`: Geared towards NEAR validator operators, offering commands for validator management and operations.

- SourceScan was mentioned as a tool that can build and deploy contracts from source code. Check it out 👉 [here](https://near.org/sourcescan.near/widget/SourceScan).

-  Developers discuss the possibility of estimating gas limits for contract calls, similar to `eth_estimateGas` in Ethereum. They also discussed potential methods and shared insights into gas estimation practices on NEAR.

- Developers discussed their experiences with both `near-cli-js` and `near-cli-rs`, sharing preferences and observations. Some found `near-cli-rs` to be more up-to-date and actively maintained compared to `near-cli-js`. However, there were differing opinions on ease of use, with some users expressing satisfaction with `near-cli-js` due to its familiarity and simplicity. Others, however, praised the features and reliability of `near-cli-rs`, especially for more advanced use cases.

- The latest `FASTNEAR API` returns FT balances. Discover more 👉 [here](https://twitter.com/fast_near/status/1773398764859847008)

- Introducing TOP100 token holders API. For every FT on NEAR, get realtime top 100 accounts. Read the 👉 [docs](https://github.com/fastnear/fastnear-api-server-rs?tab=readme-ov-file#token-id-to-top-100-accounts-by-balance-for-ft-contracts).

- Developers discussed potential future extensions and functionalities that could be integrated into a unified CLI tool for NEAR-related commands. Suggestions included incorporating additional features for managing validator nodes, optimizing contract deployment processes, and enhancing developer tools for contract testing and debugging.

- Several discussions have arisen regarding transaction order and processing efficiency on NEAR Protocol. Suggestions have been made to introduce a `broadcast_tx_async` option to improve user experience, particularly in scenarios where transaction order is not critical, such as bulk airdrops and gaming applications. The proposal aims to allow dApp developers to specify transaction ordering preferences through wallet selectors, enhancing flexibility and improving overall user experience. To discover more about recent RPC endpoint changes related to transaction processing, check out the documentation updates 👉 [here](https://docs.near.org/api/rpc/transactions#send-tx).

- A suggestion is made to yank version 0.7.1 of `near-sandbox-utils` and publish it as version 0.8.0 to ensure compatibility with older `nearcore` versions. Action is taken to remove version 0.7.1 and re-release it as version 0.8.0

- An announcement was made to contract developers about the removal of dev-accounts (dev-X-Y format) in NEAR since `nearcore` v1.37. An issue related to this change is opened in the rs sandbox testing repository

- Ongoing development on a new API wrapper aimed at reducing boilerplate code.

- Mark your calendars! The Tools Community Call is now scheduled at a regular interval. Starting next week on April 9th, it will convene every second Tuesday of the month at 5 pm UTC. Additionally, don't forget about our Docs Community Call, which occurs every 3rd Wednesday of the month, with the next one set for April 17th. Whether you want to share your work, propose discussion topics, or stay updated with the latest news, join the DevHub communities and get involved (Links can be found at the bottom of the newsletter)!

- We had discussions on integrating BOS's Social API into a Node.js project with suggestions for creating a wrapper using naxios.
Check out 👉[Naxios Repository](https://github.com/wpdas/naxios). 

- NEAR's announces partnership with ETHDam (12-14th of April). Join this chat if you'll be attending [ETHDam Hackathon](https://t.me/+l1hv9RxZCCVkNzA0).

### ETHSeoul 🇰🇷

At ETHSeoul, the DevHub devrels engaged developers with exciting bounties and insightful talks. We kicked off the event with NEAR ecosystem bounties, encouraging cross-chain product development and AI governance innovation. Talks by experts like Mike from proximity and Boris Polania from DevHub captivated the audience, providing valuable insights into Chain Signatures and decentralized intelligence. The event showcased remarkable projects, such as DeFiBrain and Connor AI, which stood out for their groundbreaking innovations. On the other hand, Connor AI, winner of the AI Governance is NEAR bounty, showcased an innovative integration of AI into DAOs, automating execution processes and empowering decentralized decision-making. 

These projects exemplified the cutting-edge applications of AI and blockchain technology, reflecting the spirit of innovation at ETHSeoul 2024.

### CHAIN ABSTRACTION COMMUNITY🤩

Comprising of hackathon participants and developers, the chain abstraction community has been engaged in discussions exploring various aspects of the technology and its potential applications. Participants exchanged ideas on projects such as account aggregation, cross-chain token arbitrage bots, multichain DEXs, lending platforms, and NFT marketplaces across multiple blockchains.

Technical discussions cover topics like deriving foreign addresses, integrating with Ethereum Layer 2 solutions, and utilizing MPC contracts for transaction signing. Members are exploring the development of multichain applications, utilizing chain signatures to enable seamless interoperability across various blockchain networks.

Developers have also provided valuable feedback on the usability and functionality of tools and SDKs related to chain abstraction, highlighting areas for improvement such as, enhanced SDK typings, and standardized CLI commands.

near-dev-news-8-3238:
Goedendag, Chain Abstractors! Welcome to NEAR Dev NEWS, your go-to destination for the freshest updates in the NEAR Developer ecosystem! NEAR lays the groundwork for all blockchain apps, offering an open-source system empowering devs to create fully decentralized, interoperable apps. In this edition, we bring you highly anticipated updates from ETHDam. Join us as we showcase the latest developer progress and technical advancements shaping the blockchain OS.


  
### FEATURED RELEASES & PR's 🤩

- `create-near-app` **Version** [6.4.0](https://github.com/near/create-near-app/releases/tag/v6.4.0) **has been released!**
👉 Sandbox testing now follows the same language as the contract created
👉 Removed vanilla frontend since very few people was using it
👉 Frontend now creates FC key for hello.near-examples.testnet by default

- `near-rust-sdk` **version 5.1.0 has been released**. The highlights of the release can be found 👉 [here](https://github.com/near/near-sdk-rs/releases/tag/near-sdk-v5.1.0).

- `nearcore` **Version 1.39.0 has been released** this week and function call base cost is reduced. For small transactions like on [Cosmose](https://twitter.com/Cosmose_) and [hotdao](https://twitter.com/hotdao_), it is a 2x reduction in cost and 2x in throughput. RPC is now faster! Learn more 👉 [here](https://github.com/near/nearcore/releases)

- `near-api-js` **Version 4.0.0 has been released**. It contains:

👉 More than 36% bundle size reduction (from 380kb to 240kb). Info 👉[here](https://bundlephobia.com/package/near-api-js@4.0.0)
👉 Failover RPC configuration
👉 Executing view functions without the need of a Connection object and more!
👉 You can read more about the changes 👉 [here](https://github.com/near/near-api-js/pull/1318)!

- `Wallet Selector` **Version 8.9.6 has been released**:

👉 Github --> https://github.com/near/wallet-selector/tree/v8.9.6
👉 NPM --> https://www.npmjs.com/package/@near-wallet-selector/core

- Discover more in releases and merged pull requests in our changelog 👉 [here](https://docs.near.org/changelog/2024/02/29/#-documentation).


  
### DEVELOPER UPDATES 🛠

- **Pagoda**: Pagoda has released [Access Keys indexer](https://near.org/dataplatform.near/widget/QueryApi.App?selectedIndexerPath=dataplatform.near/access_keys_v1) powered by QueryAPI that could be used as a drop-in replacement for KitWallet endpoint for access keys. This is yet another critical indexer powered by QueryAPI, built to showcase its reliability for critical applications. QueryAPI is currently in closed beta. You can request access [here](http://bit.ly/near-queryapi-beta) and read more in the [docs](https://docs.near.org/build/data-infrastructure/query-api/intro).

- **Pagoda**: Has released the NFT Key Smart Contract. The MPC Account Recovery smart contract provides a sign method that accepts a path parameter. This allows one predecessor account to have access to an effectively unlimited number of MPC keys. The NFT Chain Keys contract takes advantage of this property and allows secure transfers of MPC keys between users, using the NEP-171 NFT contract standard. The contract also implements new functionality to enable chain key management features.

Docs 👉 [here](https://docs.near.org/build/chain-abstraction/nft-chain-keys)

- **Rust Version and Cargo Update**: Community members have shared insights on updating Rust versions and cargo dependencies for NEAR projects. Ensure that your `rust-toolchain.toml` file reflects the latest Rust version, and consider updating dependencies with `cargo update`. Additionally, the `cargo-near` tool has fixed issues with starting templates.

- **Init Attribute Error**: Developers have encountered issues with the `#[init]` attribute in NEAR smart contracts. This error can be resolved by checking the Rust version, ensuring the correct usage of attributes, and using unique method names to avoid naming collisions. Refer to the [NEAR SDK documentation](https://docs.rs/near-sdk/latest/near_sdk/attr.near.html) for detailed information.

- **Serialization and Structs**: Community members seek guidance on using custom structs in NEAR smart contracts. The NEAR DevHub contract repository provides valuable examples of defining and using structs. Explore the [NEAR DevHub repository](https://github.com/NEAR-DevHub/neardevhub-contract) for reference and best practices.

- **Sharding Configuration**: Developers inquire about configuring sharding for NEAR networks. Understanding how account names determine shard allocation is crucial. Review the latest [shard splits](https://example.com/shard_splits) to ensure optimal deployment strategies.

- **Local Testing and Gas Limit**: Developers look for ways to bypass the 300T gas limit in local integration testing with the NEAR sandbox. Consider using tools like `near-workspaces-rs` and exploring options for adjusting gas limits during local testing.

- **Educational Content for NEAR Chain**: Community developers are actively working on educational content tailored to smart contracts created with the NEAR JavaScript SDK. A recent challenge focused on security issues targeted intermediate users. The challenge aimed to refine skills in handling transactions and ensuring security measures. You can try out the challenge [here](https://staging.agorapp.dev/ide/near/typescript/steal-the-tips/challenge).

- **Documentation Updates**: Our documentation repository recently underwent a significant reorganization, involving over 250 URL changes. We apologize for any inconvenience caused and appreciate your patience. Broken links in the documentation have been addressed promptly. If you encounter any issues, please report them [here](https://docs.github.com/), and our team will swiftly resolve them. 

- **Promise handling**: Community developers engaged in technical discussions regarding promise handling and behavior in the NEAR JavaScript SDK. Issues such as orphaned promises and transaction atomicity were explored, aiming to align behaviors with other SDKs and ensure consistency.

- **Addressing Signature Verification Challenges.**: The developer community addressed challenges related to signature verification within the wallet selector framework. A member sought assistance in signing and verifying arbitrary messages using the wallet selector, encountering hurdles, especially with signatures obtained from the Wallet.signMessage method. Insights were shared, highlighting compatibility issues with ed25519 signatures and providing resources for reference. These resources include examples from NEP-413, such as the [NEP Example reference](https://github.com/near/NEPs/pull/98), a [Wallet Selector react example](https://github.com/nearprotocol/wallet-selector), and the [Wallet Selector helper functions repository](https://github.com/nearprotocol/wallet-selector). The community expressed appreciation for the shared resources and expressed intentions to further explore them. 

- **NF Update**: NEAR Foundation Launches Infrastructure Committee with $4 Million in Funding. Learn more 👉 [here](https://pages.near.org/blog/near-launches-infrastructure-committee/)

- **DevHub Feature**: All announcements and discussions from DevHub communities in one place!
Click 👉[here](https://near.social/devhub.near/widget/app?page=announcements)

- **Fast NEAR**: Introduces FREE RPC endpoint for NEAR Protocol mainnet. Feel free to use it at [https://free.rpc.fastnear.com](https://t.co/3DVVZmaSFt)

- **MultiSig on NEAR**: Seeking documentation about MultiSig on NEAR. Check out the MultiSig contract repository 👉 [here](https://github.com/near/core-contracts/tree/master/multisig).

- **Protocol WG**: The Protocol Work Group prepares to vote on NEP-536, a proposal to optimize NEAR protocol's performance. NEP-536 focuses on reducing the number of refund receipts, a significant contributor to runtime overhead. Don't miss this opportunity to contribute to the discussion 👉 [here](https://github.com/near/NEPs/pull/536).

- **signMessage issue**: Developers provided an update on the signMessage issue and shared the latest developments on [GitHub](https://github.com/near/near-wallet/issues/3135).


  
### THIS WEEKS TIPS 💡

- `Tip`: A request was made to report broken links. The suggestion was to open an issue on the docs GitHub or make a PR with the proper link. The relevant link for documentation issues is 👉 [here](https://docs.github.com/).

- `Tip`: You can re-create a transaction in [near.cli.rs](https://github.com/near/near-cli-rs), edit it and send again with ease. Using interactive mode of near CLI, select "transaction" -> "reconstruct-transaction". You will get a new CLI command constructed for you to edit and run.

- `Tip`: Need to top-up USDT to a NEAR wallet on the test network? Use a faucet. [Faucet Link](https://near-faucet.io/).

- `Tip`: Need help checking whether a NEAR account ID exists or not? Use the fetch API available via BOS to make an RPC query call to get account information.

- `Tip` List of all the current NEAR Stakers: https://near-staking.com

- `Tip`: For more resources on Chain Signatures, check out this 👉 [linktree](https://linktr.ee/chainsignatures).

- `Tip`: **New to NEAR? 👨‍💻 :** Whether you're familiar with Rust , JS, or simply eager to contribute to NEAR tooling, begin your journey with comprehensive NEAR docs and DevHub resources 👇:

1. NEAR docs: [Link](https://docs.near.org/)
2. DevHub: [Link](https://neardevhub.org/)
3. Engage with NEAR Tools 👉[here](https://near.social/devhub.near/widget/app?page=blog&id=2496)
4. Join the Community: Have questions? Join the lively discussions in [neardev](https://t.me/neardev) Telegram group.
5. Office Hours: Get personalized assistance during our [DevHub Office Hours](https://near.social/devhub.near/widget/app?page=community&handle=devrel&tab=office-hours).

  
### RECENTLY UPDATED NEP'S ✅

**APPROVED NEPs**: 

A successful NEP is one that addresses a specific problem or needs within the NEAR ecosystem. These are the NEPs that were approved by the protocol workgroup this week:

- [NEP-519: Support for yielded execution](https://github.com/near/NEPs/pull/519) - Protocol Update | **8th March 2024**
- [NEP-491: Non-Refunable Storage](https://github.com/near/NEPs/pull/491) - Protocol Update | **26th Feb 2024**
  

**REVIEW STAGE**:

Subject matter experts are currently reviewing the following NEPs. Some of the working group members are also deciding whether to accept or reject them. Feel free to explore, these NEPs will aid you during your development as you integrate them with your dApps. Share your thoughts and leave a comment.

- [NEP-330: Build details extension](https://github.com/near/NEPs/pull/533) - Contract standards Update 
- [NEP-536: Reduce the number of refund receipts](https://github.com/near/NEPs/pull/536) - Protocol Update


To learn more about NEP's click 👉 [here](https://github.com/near/NEPs/blob/master/neps/nep-0001.md) 
To view all the NEP's click 👉 [here](https://github.com/orgs/near/projects/51/views/1)



  
### ETHDam 🏆

DevHub, represented by Owen and Lyudmil, made a significant mark at ETH Denver. With a focus on two key tracks—**Chain Signatures** and **Power your startup with NEAR**—the team encouraged developers to build solutions, from multisig wallets to cross-chain voting systems and decentralized verification layers.

Throughout the event, the DevRels provided round-the-clock support, ensuring developers had the guidance they needed to bring their ideas to life. A highlight was Owens talk on secure cross-chain transactions, which drew considerable interest.

The hackathon results were impressive, with 12 submissions in total and 7 of them implementing chain signatures. Among 382 registered hackers, winners included:

- $1,500 for 2FA and Feedback 
- $1,000 for Nevo
- $500 for Secured Jamon, JPEG Station, Octopus Layer and KudAs

[2FA](https://taikai.network/cryptocanal/hackathons/ethdam2024/projects/cluz0xnnj013uz301nfa9uj4g/idea) - A two factor authentication multisig wallet that allows one to send tokens and mint NFTs on multiple networks. "FA had a great UX, exciting implementation of chain signatures and proper use case.

  
![Sample Image](https://i.ibb.co/fd9911d/2fa.jpg)


[Feedback](https://taikai.network/cryptocanal/hackathons/ethdam2024/projects/cluyuw0j200y3yz01yjjd4rap/idea) - A privacy preserving B2C survey platform that creates a NEAR account from a participants phone number used to derive an Ethereum Account and submit a cross chain private vote. Amazing integration with survey phone calls and blockchain, great potential.

**Nevo** - Private cross chain voting with chain signatures and MACI. A very interesting use of chain signatures and good interaction between two different protocols.

**Secured Jamon** - An atomic bridge-less cross-chain assets swap that has a good use of chain signatures and complex development flow to overcome.

**JPEG Station** - Complex use of chain signatures to swap Bitcoin ordinals and Ethereum NFTs. JPEG Station has a great frontend and UX.

**Octopus Layer** - A decentralized and censorship resistant verification layer for ZK snark proofs that settles in Near and distributes ZK proofs to all blockchains through chain signatures. Awesome use of ZK on NEAR.

**KudAs** - Let's you post and receive verifiable reviews on the blockchain. Boost reputations and watch the emerging social network of blockchain attestations! Great UI. 


Looking ahead, winners have been invited to showcase their projects on the upcoming chain abstraction community call. Discussions during the call will revolve around utilizing the NEAR Multichain repository and addressing challenges encountered by developers during the hackathon.

**DevHub** extends gratitude to **CryptoCanal** for hosting a successful event and congratulates all participants and winners. 
[Link to NEAR DevHub Twitter](https://twitter.com/NEARDevHub) | [Link to ETH Denver website](https://www.ethdenver.com/)

  
![Sample Image](https://i.ibb.co/WcwGWgf/GLDX1b8-Wc-AAcb2f.jpg)


  
### QUOTE OF THE WEEK 🗣

**Azure** [Hacker from ETHDam]: " Owen and Lyudmil (DevHub DevRels)...I just had to drop a line to send a big THANK YOU your way for making the hackathon so amazing. You made my solo hacking way more enjoyable and recognizing 0x2FA as one of the winners along my friends. Seriously, you guys are rockstars! Ive made some awesome friendships and created some memorable memories with you guys."

  
### CHAIN ABSTRACTION COMMUNITY 🤩

This April , the chain abstraction community has been actively engaged in discussions and developments aimed at enhancing interoperability and standardization across different blockchain networks.They have been exploring techniques like Multi-Party Computation (MPC) to address security and key management concerns. Discussions around key rotation within MPC systems have been gaining traction, as highlighted in recent community exchanges. As part of ongoing efforts to streamline development practices, there have been discussions on standardized deployment data storage practices, with community members advocating for transparent and accessible repositories of contract deployment information. 

Check out this 👉 [GitHub repository](https://github.com/near/mpc-recovery) containing code for MPC contracts, illustrating the implementation of payload-based key management for chain signature requests and responses.

For further details, you can refer to the following links:

[Learn more about the Chain Abstraction Community](https://near.social/devhub.near/widget/app?page=community&handle=chain-abstraction)

-  Notable takeaways from the ETHDam hackathon include the importance of clear examples for constructing chain signatures with data and navigating development flows for signing and sending transactions from contracts. You are welcome to contribute to documentation resolving this. Join the [documentation Community](https://t.me/neardocscg) for more.

near-dev-news-5-3240:
Welcome to NEAR Dev NEWS, your prime source for the latest in the NEAR Developer ecosystem! NEAR lays the groundwork for all blockchain apps, offering an open-source system empowering devs to create fully decentralized, interoperable apps. Our Digest showcases developer progress and technical updates shaping the blockchain OS.

Before we kick into updates for the new week, please take the time to fill it out our survey and play a pivotal role in shaping the ecosystem. Your feedback will provide valuable info to builders and contributors, paving the way for FRPs (Request for proposals) on DevHub. 

###### [CLICK HERE TO FILL SURVEY 🏆](https://bit.ly/devhub-survey-q1-2024)

Thank you for participating, now let’s get into the updates!

  
### FEATURED RELEASES & PR's 🤩

- `nearcore`: Version 1.38.0 has been released . This contains a protocol upgrade. learn more 👉 [here](https://github.com/near/nearcore/releases/tag/1.38.0)

- `VM` [Released version 2.6.0](https://github.com/NearSocial/VM/releases/tag/2.6.0): VM execution layer for decentralized frontend components.

- `near-sdk-rs` [Released version near-sdk-v5.0.0](https://github.com/near/near-sdk-rs/releases/tag/near-sdk-v5.0.0): Rust SDK for writing smart contracts.

- `near-cli-rs`: 0.8.0 -> 0.8.1 (✓ API compatible changes). To update `near` CLI use: near extensions `self-update`

- Discover more in releases and merged pull requests in our changelog 👉 [here](https://docs.near.org/changelog/2024/02/29/#-documentation).


  
### DEVELOPER UPDATES 🛠

- Next release of `near-api-js` will include the ability to select transaction finality. Release expected in the next couple of days.

- Developers are exploring the implementation of a broadcast_tx_async-based wallet to enhance user experience within the NEAR ecosystem.

- `New Documentation`: Discover how your NEAR account can control accounts on other chains, such as Ethereum, through Chain Signatures. Learn more in our new articles:

👉[What are Chain Signatures?](https://docs.near.org/concepts/abstraction/chain-signatures)
👉[Create a Chain Signature](https://docs.near.org/abstraction/chain-signatures)

- Chain Abstraction, What is it? Learn about it 👉 [here](https://twitter.com/NEARDevHub/status/1772615619168403619).

- Learn about Chain Abstractions goals 👉 [here](https://twitter.com/ilblackdragon/status/1770890267018535308).

- Community members compare gas costs between contracts compiled from JavaScript SDK and contracts compiled from Rust to WASM, revealing significant differences in gas consumption.

👉 Rust based WASM: [Transaction Link](https://testnet.nearblocks.io/txns/J8MiLqghiWxRWhogsZSRVYYaJx4WRbAKcUuM1xMDu5fJ#)
👉 JS based WASM: [Transaction Link](https://testnet.nearblocks.io/txns/25MufUqsgeuQAJ9EZXKdSgrjuCmMHHFyMtNKx1i9Fe9q#)

Reason: Rust's strong typing and memory safety features can lead to more robust and secure contracts, but they also introduce additional overhead in terms of gas costs due to the need for stricter memory management and error handling mechanisms. 

- Check out this deep dive into [Lava Network](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=V-16v_h0s5s). To stay updated on cutting edge tech, be sure to check out the rest of our [whiteboard series](https://www.youtube.com/@NEARProtocol/search?query=whiteboard)!

- We received positive feedback on community tools' functionality and smooth operation. Efte, a member of our tools community shares thoughts: "Yea I am pretty happy with tooling by now, Everything works smooth and I like it a lot.
Would be happy to work together with somebody to create FT, NFT and / or cross contract call walkthroughs and youtube videos even".

- There's been discussions on the possibility of re-deploying contracts from JavaScript to Rust while preserving state. It's possible, but you will need to make sure that your Rust version can read the serialized data stored in the state. You can use `near.cli.rs` to view your contract storage to make that decision: `near contract view-storage`. 

- **DevHub** announces a significant upgrade to DevHub that revolutionizes the funding journey. Detailed information about the revamped proposal submission and funding process aligned with DevDAO's mission can be found 👉 [here](https://near.social/devhub.near/widget/app?page=blog&id=3251).

- Discussion on renaming `near-cli-rs` to reduce confusion in the ecosystem, suggesting `inear` (Interactive NEAR) as an alternative.

- Confirmation that contracts can be annotated using either the verbose 5.0.0 way or the concise 5.1+ way, providing flexibility and backward compatibility.

- Consideration of handling annotations in documentation, particularly the transition from `#[near_bindgen]` to `#[near]`, is discussed because there's a shift in the SDK's approach to contract annotations. With the release of SDK 5.1+, the #[near] annotation is introduced as a more concise alternative to #[near_bindgen]. This transition is significant for developers as it affects how they annotate their contracts and interact with the NEAR ecosystem. 

By adopting #[near], developers can reduce the boilerplate code and make their contracts more concise, enhancing readability and maintainability. There's also a discussion on the importance of handling contract annotations in the documentation.

-  Interest expressed in FastAuth, an authentication mechanism for NEAR Protocol, aimed at simplifying onboarding and account recovery. You can find more information about FastAuth here: 

👉 [NEAR Wiki](https://wiki.near.org/overview/BOS/fast-auth) 
👉 [NEAR blog](https://pages.near.org/blog/fastauth-sdk-beta-now-available/)

It's also mentioned that FastAuth should work on testnet, and while there might not be extensive example implementations readily available, contributions to improve documentation and examples are welcome. [Documentation Community](https://t.me/neardocscg)

- Users encounter errors while attempting to create accounts on NEAR testnet. The issue appears to stem from account creation scripts lacking necessary private key configurations. Community members provide troubleshooting advice and code snippets to resolve the issue. [Link to discussions](https://t.me/neardev/41846)

- A recent change in the NEAR RPC API caused disruptions for some applications, prompting concerns about backward compatibility and proper deprecation warnings. However, the change has since been reverted to address the issue and ensure continuity for developers relying on the NEAR RPC API. 

- Stay updated with the NEAR Validator upgrade: [NEAR Validator Update](https://pages.near.org/blog/an-update-on-the-near-validator-upgrade/?ssp=1&setlang=en&cc=AT&safesearch=moderate).

-  Ecosystem Developers explore methods for updating contract metadata and ensuring changes propagate to indexers. [Join Tools Community](https://t.me/NEAR_Tools_Community_Group)

- Community members discuss NEAR Protocol contract addresses and share pull requests for fixing issues in NEAR Lake Indexer. [Join Near dev community](https://t.me/neardev)

- Join us as we celebrate the activation of six shards on NEAR Protocol!

- Explore `near-api-js` updates and signing messages guidance in the [near-api-js Cookbook](https://github.com/near/near-api-js/blob/master/packages/cookbook/utils/verify-signature.js).

- In the next release of `near-api-js`, you will be able to choose the finality of the transaction using the new `send_tx` method. This release will be live in the next couple of days. See the changes [here](https://github.com/near/nearcore/blob/447572bb775a5954ca7a5a4b65c85b45aab9e499/chain/jsonrpc/CHANGELOG.md#023).

- A participant shared their website, which won a prize in the NEAR Hacks hackathon. https://nearvisionai.streamlit.app/.  more can be found on the results page https://nearhacks.hackerearth.com/. 

- Ongoing development on a new API wrapper aimed at reducing boilerplate code.

- We had discussions on integrating BOS's Social API into a Node.js project with suggestions for creating a wrapper using naxios.
Check out 👉[Naxios Repository](https://github.com/wpdas/naxios). 

- An issue was raised regarding refunding users for storage usage in a contract, where the function returned the same value at the start and end. Suggestions were provided to force changes to storage by calling `.flush()` on the collections if using `near_sdk::store` collections.

- A user discussed an issue with `near-sdk-js` where a JS error occurred during build, potentially related to contract state initialization. Suggestions included trying to deploy to a fresh account and avoiding inheritance with `@NearBindgen`. Check out 👉 [NEAR SDK JS repo](https://github.com/near/near-sdk-js).

### CHAIN ABSTRACTION COMMUNITY🤩

Comprising of hackathon participants and developers, the chain abstraction community has been engaged in discussions exploring various aspects of the technology and its potential applications. Participants exchanged ideas on projects such as account aggregation, cross-chain token arbitrage bots, multichain DEXs, lending platforms, and NFT marketplaces across multiple blockchains.

Technical discussions cover topics like deriving foreign addresses, integrating with Ethereum Layer 2 solutions, and utilizing MPC contracts for transaction signing. Members are exploring the development of multichain applications, utilizing chain signatures to enable seamless interoperability across various blockchain networks.

Developers have also provided valuable feedback on the usability and functionality of tools and SDKs related to chain abstraction, highlighting areas for improvement such as, enhanced SDK typings, and standardized CLI commands.


For further details, you can refer to the following links:

near-dev-news-4-3243:
Welcome to NEAR Dev NEWS, your prime source for the latest in the NEAR Developer ecosystem! NEAR lays the groundwork for all blockchain apps, offering an open-source system empowering devs to create fully decentralized, interoperable apps. Our Digest showcases developer progress and technical updates shaping the blockchain OS.

Before we kick into updates for the new week, please take the time to fill out our survey and play a pivotal role in shaping the ecosystem. Your feedback will provide valuable info to builders and contributors, paving the way for FRPs (Request for proposals) on **DevHub**. 

#### [CLICK HERE TO FILL SURVEY 🏆](https://bit.ly/devhub-survey-q1-2024)

Thank you for participating, now let’s get into the updates!

  
### FEATURED RELEASES & PR's 🤩

- `near-discovery` [Released on 02-27-2024](https://github.com/near/near-discovery/releases/tag/02-27-2024): near.org Decentralized Frontend Gateway.  Alpha testers are needed , more info in the "CALL FOR CONTRIBUTORS / OPPORTUNITIES" section.
- `VM` [Released version 2.6.0](https://github.com/NearSocial/VM/releases/tag/2.6.0): VM execution layer for decentralized frontend components.
- `near-sdk-rs` [Released version near-sdk-v5.0.0](https://github.com/near/near-sdk-rs/releases/tag/near-sdk-v5.0.0): Rust SDK for writing smart contracts.
- `bos-cli-rs` [Command line utility for developing decentralized frontend components - Version 0.8.1](https://github.com/near/near-cli-rs/releases/tag/v0.8.1).
- `near-api-js`: [Fix delegate schema #1314](https://github.com/near/near-api-js/pull/1314) : In response to an issue hindering meta-transaction creation, a PR was swiftly merged, fixing a serialization error in transaction relay.
- `near-cli-rs`: Added the ability to output a signed transaction (serialized as base64) to a file 
- `near-cli-rs`: 0.8.0 -> 0.8.1 (✓ API compatible changes). To update `near` CLI use: near extensions `self-update`


- Discover more in releases and merged pull requests in our changelog 👉 [here](https://docs.near.org/changelog/2024/02/29/#-documentation).


  
### DEVELOPER UPDATES 🛠


- A brilliant [dev tool idea](https://near.org/near/widget/PostPage?accountId=frol.near&blockHeight=114752035) was recently shared within the NEAR community: an idea to effortlessly generate TypeScript types from NEAR smart contract ABIs. Today, we're thrilled to announce this concept has been brought to life by SurgeCode! Say hello to `near2ts` - the tool you've been waiting for to streamline your NEAR smart contract development journey. Explore it now on 👉 [Github](https://github.com/SurgeCode/near2ts).

- We're thrilled to announce the implementation of automated PR merging for near-api-js. This enhancement streamlines the merging process, ensuring faster integration of contributions. Check out the details 👉 [here](https://github.com/near/near-api-js/pull/1315).

- Various members collaborated on resolving issues and improving documentation in projects like `near-sdk-rs`. [Documentation Community](https://t.me/neardocscg)

- Configuration for the bos-workspace GitHub workflow now utilizes non-archival RPC. Find out more 👉 [here](https://github.com/NEARBuilders/bos-workspace/blob/main/.github/workflows/deploy.yml).

- We encourage contributors to not only focus on code examples but also on enhancing our documentation. By contributing to our documentation, you're helping to create a better experience for all developers. Check out our [documentation](https://docs.near.org/) and see where you can contribute!

- `New Documentation`: Discover how your NEAR account can control accounts on other chains, such as Ethereum, through Chain Signatures. Learn more in our new articles:

👉[What are Chain Signatures?](https://docs.near.org/concepts/abstraction/chain-signatures)
👉[Create a Chain Signature](https://docs.near.org/abstraction/chain-signatures)

- Interested in implementing a time-based lock mechanism on the NEAR blockchain? Check out these resources for step-by-step tutorials and examples:

👉 [FT Lockup Contract](https://github.com/NearDeFi/ft-lockup-contract)
👉 [Core Contracts Lockup](https://github.com/near/core-contracts/tree/master/lockup)

- Encountering issues with RPC or importing accounts? Dive into community discussions to find solutions and support: [Link to Community](https://t.me/neardev).

- Questions have arisen regarding the visibility of smart contract source code on the NEAR blockchain compared to Ethereum. While Ethereum's Etherscan allows code uploads, NEAR lacks this functionality. Projects like SourceScan aim to change this. Their most recent proposal can be found 👉 [here](https://near.social/devhub.near/widget/app?page=post&id=3078)

- Developers are sharing techniques for dealing with accounts with large state on the NEAR blockchain, including using specific contracts and commands to manage and clean up excessive storage. Refer to 👉 [How to delete NEAR account with large state](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/70616916/how-to-delete-near-account-with-large-state).

- Stay updated with the NEAR Validator upgrade: [NEAR Validator Update](https://pages.near.org/blog/an-update-on-the-near-validator-upgrade/?ssp=1&setlang=en&cc=AT&safesearch=moderate).

- Concerns about version compatibility across @near-js packages were brought up, sparking discussions on aligning versions and implementing semantic versioning.

- Explore `near-api-js` updates and signing messages guidance in the [near-api-js Cookbook](https://github.com/near/near-api-js/blob/master/packages/cookbook/utils/verify-signature.js).

- In the next release of `near-api-js`, you will be able to choose the finality of the transaction using the new `send_tx` method. This release will be live in the next couple of days. See the changes [here](https://github.com/near/nearcore/blob/447572bb775a5954ca7a5a4b65c85b45aab9e499/chain/jsonrpc/CHANGELOG.md#023).

- Some users experienced issues importing accounts through the wallet transfer wizard due to revoked access keys still being linked. As a solution, the Meteor Wallet team is implementing an access key list check during import to prevent users from importing accounts linked to revoked access keys.

- Interested in running a node yourself? Join the [Community Run Nodes TG group](https://t.me/communityNodes).

- Contributors are preparing to collaborate on closing the gap in deployment components. [Documentation Community](https://t.me/neardocscg)

- Developers highlight the importance of streamlining deployment processes. We're moving towards simpler tools like "Token Farm" and "Keypom" to facilitate easier deployment. Stay tuned for further developments in this area.

- Developers discuss transaction per second (TPS) concerns and gas costs on the NEAR chain. There are mentions of potential improvements with features like stateless validating and [FastNear](https://twitter.com/fast_near).

- What if you can use AI in a smart contract? Now you can! The contract is deployed on "gpt4.near" it has a fairly simple API to make requests. Each request costs 0.01 NEAR and 100 Tgas per call. You can try it today and it's fully open-source. 👉 [Learn more](https://twitter.com/ekuzyakov/status/1756812620655391033)

- Looking for a Library for deriving a near address from an 0x address? Check out [Github](https://github.com/near-examples/near-multichain).

- What is NEAR Data Availability . More details 👉 [here](https://twitter.com/prophet_node/status/1769121059578561014?s=46).

- Making Blockchains Invisible via Chain Abstraction (Feat Illia Poloshukin & Jaemin Jin) . Watch the recap 👉 [here](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=QGYmABXBPxc).

- Chain Abstraction Demo: Buying [@OpenSea](https://twitter.com/opensea) NFTs from [@MintbaseWallet](https://twitter.com/mintbasewallet) on testnet using NEARProtocol's MPC. Details 👉 [here](https://twitter.com/mintbase/status/1769748329619992792?s=46).

- Subgraph support from [@graphprotocol](https://twitter.com/graphprotocol) has been brought to NEAR Protocol. One more step toward chain abstraction. Learn more [here](https://twitter.com/nearprotocol/status/1768323382708240887)

- NEAR protocol contributors occasionally hold calls to discuss technical papers: Check out [ZulipChat](https://near.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/295302-general/topic/Paper.20reading.20seminar)

- We're excited to announce the champions of the NEAR bounties from ETHDenver24!  👉 [Twitter thread](https://twitter.com/NEARDevHub/status/1768747575073792027?s=19)

- `Tip`: **New to NEAR? 👨‍💻 :** Whether you're familiar with Rust , JS, or simply eager to contribute to NEAR tooling, begin your journey with comprehensive NEAR docs and DevHub resources 👇:

1. NEAR docs: [Link](https://docs.near.org/)
2. DevHub: [Link](https://neardevhub.org/)
3. Join the Community: Have questions? Join the lively discussions in [neardev](https://t.me/neardev) Telegram group.
4. Office Hours: Get personalized assistance during our [DevHub Office Hours](https://near.social/devhub.near/widget/app?page=community&handle=devrel&tab=office-hours).

A successful NEP is one that addresses a specific problem or needs within the NEAR ecosystem. These are the NEPs that were approved by the protocol workgroup this week:

Comprising of hackathon participants and developers, the chain abstraction community has been engaged in discussions exploring various aspects of the technology and its potential applications. Participants exchanged ideas on projects such as account aggregation, cross-chain token arbitrage bots, multichain DEXs, lending platforms, and NFT marketplaces across multiple blockchains.
